docs.text: Bluetooth Connect # Connect for playback only (works) sudo virtual_oss -C 2 -c 2 -r 48000 -b 16 -s 1024 -R /dev/null -P /dev/bluetooth/00:00:00:00:00:00 -T /dev/sndstat -d dsp # Connect for playback & recording (didn't work, complained about PSM) sudo virtual_oss -C 2 -c 2 -r 48000 -b 16 -s 1024 -f /dev/bluetooth/00:00:00:00:00:00 -T /dev/sndstat -d dsp Prepare & Diagnostics # Install packages pkg install audio/virtual_oss # Load kernel modules and install packages kldload ng_ubt kldload acpi_ibm # Check sysctl variables (e.g. dev.acpi_ibm.0.bluetooth=1) sysctl -a | grep -i "bluetooth" # Touch config file as it is required to exist touch /etc/bluetooth/bthidd.conf # Start services service bthidd start service hcsecd start # Pair device (put it into pairing mode & note PIN code if required by device) bluetooth-config # Create/check connection hccontrol -n ubt0hci create_connection 00:00:00:00:00:00 hccontrol -n ubt0hci read_connection_list Files /boot/loader.conf acpi_ibm_load="YES" ng_ubt_load="YES" /etc/rc.conf bthidd_enable="YES" hcsecd_enable="YES" bluetooth_enable="YES" /etc/bluetooth/hosts # Enter host->addr entries here to reference by name instead of by addr /etc/bluetooth/hcsecd.conf device { bdaddr 00:00:00:00:00:00; name "My BT Device"; key nokey; pin "0000"; }
docs.title: Bluetooth

docs.text: # Connect for playback only (works) sudo virtual_oss -C 2 -c 2 -r 48000 -b 16 -s 1024 -R /dev/null -P /dev/bluetooth/00:00:00:00:00:00 -T /dev/sndstat -d dsp # Connect for playback & recording (didn't work, complained about PSM) sudo virtual_oss -C 2 -c 2 -r 48000 -b 16 -s 1024 -f /dev/bluetooth/00:00:00:00:00:00 -T /dev/sndstat -d dsp
docs.title: Connect

docs.text: # Install packages pkg install audio/virtual_oss # Load kernel modules and install packages kldload ng_ubt kldload acpi_ibm # Check sysctl variables (e.g. dev.acpi_ibm.0.bluetooth=1) sysctl -a | grep -i "bluetooth" # Touch config file as it is required to exist touch /etc/bluetooth/bthidd.conf # Start services service bthidd start service hcsecd start # Pair device (put it into pairing mode & note PIN code if required by device) bluetooth-config # Create/check connection hccontrol -n ubt0hci create_connection 00:00:00:00:00:00 hccontrol -n ubt0hci read_connection_list
docs.title: Prepare & Diagnostics

docs.text: acpi_ibm_load="YES" ng_ubt_load="YES"
docs.title: /boot/loader.conf

docs.text: bthidd_enable="YES" hcsecd_enable="YES" bluetooth_enable="YES"
docs.title: /etc/rc.conf

docs.text: # Enter host->addr entries here to reference by name instead of by addr
docs.title: /etc/bluetooth/hosts

docs.text: device { bdaddr 00:00:00:00:00:00; name "My BT Device"; key nokey; pin "0000"; }
docs.title: /etc/bluetooth/hcsecd.conf
